data.question: What is the chemical formula of the calixarene-based metal-organic framework discussed?
What is the specific BET surface area of the discussed MOF?
What gas is the MOF highly selective for detecting?
What method was used to confirm the stability of the material?
data.answer: Powder X-ray diffraction and 1H NMR spectroscopy

data.question: What is the role of Lewis acids mentioned in the context of the MOF?
data.answer: Lewis acids can greatly reduce the irreversible nitration of calixarenes upon NO2 exposure.

data.question: What happens to the MOF when exposed to NO2?
data.answer: It changes color from white to dark blue.

data.question: What is the maximum diameter of a sphere that could pass through the complete pore system of the MOF?

Can the MOF detect NO gas?
What is the role of formic, acetic, or propionic acid in the synthesis of the MOF?
What temperature is required for the crystallization of the MOF?
Is the MOF stable in aqueous acidic conditions at room temperature?
Does the presence of humidity affect the NO2 detection capability of the MOF?
What is the observed shift in the C=O vibration when acetone coordinates to Lewis acids in the MOF?
What is the absorption maximum in the UV/Vis spectra of the MOF after prolonged NO2 exposure?
What does the presence of a band at 1942 cm@1 in the IR spectra imply?
data.answer: The complexation of NO+ inside the calixarene cavity
